description.narrative: 1. Food and Nutrition Security: As a result of the Project, the Company's increased pulses processing capacity will contribute to food and nutrition security in India, as it will help reduce the gap between actual and WHO recommended levels of protein intake, while following international food safety standards. 2. Domestic Manufacturing Capacity Building and Job Creation: In supporting the building of one of the largest pulses processing facilities in the world, the IFC investment supports the expansion of domestic processing of pulses (instead of importing "processed" pulses), providing an impetus to Government of India initiatives of 'Make in India' and 'Skill India'. This will generate incremental jobs and income, government revenues and widen the tax base as well as support economic growth. 3. Northeastern States: The funding will be used entirely towards setting up a processing facility in West Bengal, one of the lower income states in India.

Headquartered in Mumbai, India, ETC Agro Processing (India) Private Limited (ETC Agro or the Company), along with its associate entity ETG Agro Private Limited, are engaged in pulses processing and trading, wheat flour milling and biscuit manufacturing. The Company is in the process of setting up a new pulses processing facility of 300,000 MTPA in Kolkata, West Bengal, which, once completed, will be one of the largest pulses processing plants in the world, handling processing of yellow peas, lentils, green gram and black gram (the Project). The Project will allow the Company and its associate entity to expand their existing pulses processing capacity in India to about 475,000 MTPA to provide high-quality processed pulses to the Indian market; pulses are a key source of protein and an integral part of the diet of the Indian population.
